Detailed Description

Terrestrial objects are ones that walk around on the ground and can jump.

Todo:
The logic dealing with crawling (and, in particular, forcing crawls when there's no headroom) is rather convoluted and should be improved.

Member Function Documentation

def data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.adjustFootCollision (   self,
  collision 
)

Fix the "toe-stubbing" problem (of running horizontally into a block at foot level) by reversing gravity.

Recognize this situation because we're on the ground, getting ejected straight horizontally by a block at foot level that has no block above it.

def data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.applyMovement (   self,
  accelFactor,
  decelFactor 
)

Move according to input, using the provided acceleration or deceleration depending on the direction pressed, our own velocity, and our facing.

def data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.blockIsAtFootLevel (   self,
  block 
)

Return true if the given block is near our foot level.

def data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.canGrabLedge (   self  ) 

Return true if we are in position to grab the top of a block.

We can only grab blocks that do not have other blocks above them. There are two possible blocks we can grab: the top of a square block, or the bottom of a triangular one.

def data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.getExtremalPoint (   self,
  targetHeight,
  shouldUseBack = False 
)

Return the point on the polygon that matches the target height and is on the given side.

def data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.getFootLoc (   self,
  shouldUseBack = False 
)

Return the "foot" of this object, which is the bottom vertex of the bounding polygon that is furthest in our direction of travel.

def data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.getHeadLoc (   self,
  shouldUseBack = False 
)

As getFootLoc, but applies to the top of the object instead of the bottom.

def data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.preCollisionUpdate (   self  ) 

Update to perform before doing collision detection.

Rate at which slowing to a stop on the ground detracts from velocity.

data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.runDirection

Direction creature is trying to move in.

Set this to -1 to move left, 0 to not move, or 1 to move right.

data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.shouldClimb

Used to signal that the creature has started climbing from a hanging position.

data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.shouldCrawl

Used to signal that the creature should try to crawl.

data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.shouldJump

Used to signal that the creature has started a jump.

Set this in your AI routines to jump.

data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.shouldReleaseHang

Used to signal that the creature has stopped hanging.

data.objects.base.terrestrialobject.TerrestrialObject.state

ObjectState derivative that handles our movement logic.
